abstract: I argue that a successful switch from one methodology to another requires a switch from one <i>ontology</i> to another. Large-scale adoption of a new methodology means "infecting" people with new ideas about what sorts of things there are in the (software development) world and how those things hang together. The paper ends with some suggestions to methodology creators about how to design methodologies that encourage the needed "gestalt switch."
title: Methodology work is ontology work
